Repositories.TOASTR_MSG_DELETED_ERROR: Unexpected issue. Repository has not been removed.

Roas.ALERT_MSG_P1: Some ROAs may be missing because the following Trust Anchors still have pending repositories:

Bgp.INFO: This page provides a preview of the likely RPKI validity states your routers will associate with BGP announcements. This preview is based on:
Bgp.INFO1: The RIPE NCC Route Collector information that was last updated
Bgp.INFO2: BGP announcements that are seen by 5 or more peers.
Bgp.INFO4: The validated ROAs found by this RPKI Validator after applying your filters and additional whitelist entries.
Bgp.INFO5: Please note that the BGP announcements your routers see may differ from the ones listed here.

AnnouncementPreview.TITLE_MODAL_FORM: Please enter both an ASN and a Prefix
AnnouncementPreview.TOASTR_MSG_ERROR: Specified prefix and/or ASN are not valid

IgnoreFilters.ALERT_MSG_INTRO: You can use filters to exclude ROAs matching an ASN and/or prefix.
IgnoreFilters.TOASTR_MSG_ADD_ERROR: Unexpected issue. Filter had not been added.
IgnoreFilters.TOASTR_MSG_DELETE_ERROR: Unexpected issue. Filter has not been removed.

Whitelist.ALERT_MSG_INTRO_1st: By adding a whitelist entry you can manually authorise an ASN to originate a prefix in addition to the validated ROAs from the repository.
Whitelist.ALERT_MSG_INTRO_2nd: Please note that whitelist entries may invalidate announcements for this prefix from other ASNs, just like ROAs. This may be intentional (you are whitelisting ASN A, ASN B is hijacking), or not (ASN B should also be authorised, or you made a mistake). When you create a whitelist entry here, make sure to check the table below for a report on prefixes validated / invalidated by this entry and verify that no unintentional side effects occured.
Whitelist.EM_MSG_INVALID_IPV4_MAX_PREFIX_LENGTH: Max length must be between 0 and 32 for IPv4
Whitelist.EM_MSG_INVALID_IPV6_MAX_PREFIX_LENGTH: Max length must be between 0 and 128 for IPv6
Whitelist.EM_MSG_INVALID_MAX_PREFIX_LENGTH_RANGE: Max length cannot be shorter than prefix length
Whitelist.TOASTR_MSG_REQUIRED_PREFIX_AND_ASN: Prefix and ASN are both required.
Whitelist.TOASTR_MSG_ADD_ERROR: Unexpected issue. Whitelist entry has not been added.
Whitelist.TOASTR_MSG_DELETED_ERROR: Unexpected issue. Whitelist entry has not been removed.
Whitelist.TOASTR_MAX_LENGTH_LONGER_32: Max length must be between 0 and 32 for IPv4
Whitelist.TOASTR_MAX_LENGTH_LONGER_128: Max length must be between 0 and 128 for IPv6
Whitelist.TOASTR_MAX_LENGTH_LONGER_PREFIX_LENGTH: Max length cannot be shorter than prefix length
Whitelist.CLICK_LINK_TO_ANNOUNCEMENT: Click link to see details about announcement

Export.DESCRIPTION: Here you are able to export the complete ROA data set for use in an existing BGP decision making workflow. The output will be in CSV or JSON format and consist of all validated ROAs, minus your ignore filter entries, plus your whitelist entries.

Slurm.SLURM: Import / Export Filter and Whitelist Entries
Slurm.DESCRIPTION: You can use a so-called Simplified Local internet nUmber Resource Management (SLURM) file to export/import your filter and whitelist entries. Note that your settings will be replaced if you upload a file.
Slurm.UPLOAD_FAILED: Upload failed! File cannot be parsed.
Slurm.SUCCESS_LOADED: File uploaded, your filters and whitelist entries were updated.
